1 - autogen-require-drop-all validation failure: Containers must drop `ALL` capabilities.

policy drop-cap-net-raw -> resource default/Deployment/kafka-broker failed:
1 - autogen-require-drop-cap-net-raw validation failure: Containers must drop the `CAP_NET_RAW` capability.

1 - autogen-check-for-labels validation error: The label `app.kubernetes.io/name` is required. rule autogen-check-for-labels failed at path /spec/template/metadata/labels/app.kubernetes.io/name/

##### FILE: kahuna.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/kahuna:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: kahuna
  name: kahuna
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: kahuna
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: kahuna
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
              name: grid-aws-access-token
        - name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
              name: grid-aws-access-token
        - name: PLAY_SECRET
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: play-secret
              name: grid-play-secret
        image: eu.gcr.io/grid-301122/kahuna:containerised
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /management/healthcheck
            port: 9000
          initialDelaySeconds: 120
        name: kahuna
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /management/healthcheck
            port: 9000
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 384Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/gu
          name: gu-config
        - mountPath: /etc/grid
          name: grid-config
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: gu
        name: gu-config
      - configMap:
          name: grid
        name: grid-config

##### FILE: kaniko1.yaml #####

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/kaniko:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  labels:
    app: kaniko
  name: kaniko
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - sh
    - -c
    - |
      # shutdown() {
      # kill -TERM "$pid"
      # wait "$pid"
      # exit 0
      # }
      # trap 'shutdown' SIGINT SIGTERM
      # sleep infinity &
      # pid=$!
      # wait "$pid"
      /kaniko/executor \
      --skip-tls-verify \
      --insecure \
      --context "/shared/buildcontext" \
      --destination "registry:5000/postfix:latest"
    image: gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor:v1.23.2-debug
    name: kaniko
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /shared
      name: shared
    workingDir: /shared
  initContainers:
  - args:
    - -c
    - |
      set -ex
      git clone https://github.com/WiltonCarvalho/apache-php-fpm-in-docker
      mv apache-php-fpm-in-docker/postfix buildcontext
      rm -rf apache-php-fpm-in-docker
    command:
    - /bin/sh
    image: alpine/git
    name: init
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /shared
      name: shared
    workingDir: /shared
  restartPolicy: Never
  volumes:
  - emptyDir: {}
    name: shared

##### FILE: kaniko-builder2.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kaniko/Pod/kaniko-builder:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  annotations:
    cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
  name: kaniko-builder
  namespace: kaniko
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - sh
    - -c
    - |
      # Docker registry secret is mapped to /root/.docker but since
      # docker container expects the credentials to be read from a file
      # labelled as config.json, lets do that next
      mkdir -p /workspace/.docker
      cp /root/.docker/.dockerconfigjson /workspace/.docker/config.json

      # Extract the username from mounted registry secret
      registrySecret=$(cat /workspace/.docker/config.json)
      pattern='"username":"([^"]+)"'
      if echo "$registrySecret" | grep -qE "$pattern"; then
          # Extract the value from the first capturing group
          docker_username=$(echo "$registrySecret" |
                            grep -Eo "$pattern" |
                            sed 's/.*"\([^"]\+\)".*/\1/')
      fi

      /kaniko/executor \
      --context /workspace \
      --dockerfile /workspace/${DOCKER_FILENAME} \
      --destination docker.io/$docker_username/${DOCKER_IMAGENAME}:${DOCKER_IMAGETAG}
    env:
    - name: DOCKER_CONFIG
      value: /workspace/.docker
    - name: DOCKER_FILENAME
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: DOCKER_FILENAME
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    - name: DOCKER_IMAGENAME
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: DOCKER_IMAGENAME
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    - name: DOCKER_IMAGETAG
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: DOCKER_IMAGETAG
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    image: gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor:v1.20.0-debug
    name: image-builder
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /workspace
      name: dockerfiles
    - mountPath: /root/.docker
      name: docker-secret
  initContainers:
  - command:
    - sh
    - -c
    - "# Check if image name was given\n[[ ! -z \"${DOCKER_IMAGENAME}\" && ! -z \"${DOCKER_IMAGETAG}\"
      ]] || {\n    echo -e \"\\nDOCKER_IMAGENAME and/or DOCKER_IMAGETAG environment
      variables not set using configMaps!!!\\n\"\n    exit 2\n}\n\n# Check if user
      desires to build the image regardless if it exists in registry\n[[ \"${FORCE_BUILD}\"
      != \"Y\" ]] || {\n    echo -e \"\\nForce build!!!\\n\"\n    exit 0\n}\n\n# Docker
      registry secret is mapped to /root/.docker but since \n# docker container expects
      the credentials to be read from a file\n# labelled as config.json, lets do that
      next\nmkdir -p /workspace/.docker\ncp /root/.docker/.dockerconfigjson /workspace/.docker/config.json\n\n#
      Extract the username from mounted registry secret\nregistrySecret=$(cat /workspace/.docker/config.json)\npattern='\"username\":\"([^\"]+)\"'\nif
      echo \"$registrySecret\" | grep -qE \"$pattern\"; then\n    # Extract the value
      from the first capturing group\n    docker_username=$(echo \"$registrySecret\"
      | \n                      grep -Eo \"$pattern\" | \n                      sed
      's/.*\"\\([^\"]\\+\\)\".*/\\1/')\nfi\n\n# Check if images are in docker hub\nif
      docker manifest inspect docker.io/$docker_username/${DOCKER_IMAGENAME}:${DOCKER_IMAGETAG}
      > /dev/null 2>&1\nthen\n    echo -e \"\\n${DOCKER_IMAGENAME}:${DOCKER_IMAGETAG}
      image available!!!\\n\"\n    exit 1\nelse\n    echo -e \"\\n${DOCKER_IMAGENAME}:${DOCKER_IMAGETAG}
      NOT available. Running builder container!!!\\n\"\n    exit 0\nfi\n"
    env:
    - name: DOCKER_CONFIG
      value: /workspace/.docker
    - name: DOCKER_IMAGENAME
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: DOCKER_IMAGENAME
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    - name: DOCKER_IMAGETAG
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: DOCKER_IMAGETAG
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    - name: FORCE_BUILD
      valueFrom:
        configMapKeyRef:
          key: FORCE_BUILD
          name: my-kaniko-builder-configmap
    image: docker:20.10
    name: kaniko-init
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /root/.docker
      name: docker-secret
  restartPolicy: Never
  volumes:
  - hostPath:
      path: /workspace
    name: dockerfiles
  - name: docker-secret
    secret:
      secretName: docker-config-secret

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.

policy drop-cap-net-raw -> resource kaniko/Pod/kaniko-builder failed:

kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: kapinger-good
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: kapinger
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: kapinger
        server: good
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: GODEBUG
          value: netdns=go
        - name: TARGET_TYPE
          value: service
        - name: POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: HTTP_PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: TCP_PORT
          value: "8085"
        - name: UDP_PORT
          value: "8086"
        - name: BURST_INTERVAL_MS
          value: "500"
        - name: BURST_VOLUME
          value: "1"
        image: acnpublic.azurecr.io/kapinger:20241009.5
        name: kapinger
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 20Mi
          requests:
            memory: 20Mi

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to jx/ConfigMap/kapp-config:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  config.yml: |
    apiVersion: kapp.k14s.io/v1alpha1
    kind: Config

    changeRuleBindings:
    - rules:
      - "upsert after upserting apps.jenkins-x.io/ingress-nginx"
      resourceMatchers:
      - apiVersionKindMatcher: {kind: Ingress, apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1beta1}

    - rules:
      - "delete before deleting apps.jenkins-x.io/pusher-wave"
      resourceMatchers:
      - andMatcher:
          matchers:
            - apiVersionKindMatcher: {kind: Deployment, apiVersion: apps/v1}
            - notMatcher:
                matcher:
                  hasAnnotationMatcher:
                    keyvalues:
                    - key: kapp.k14s.io/change-group
                      value: apps.jenkins-x.io/pusher-wave
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  annotations:
    meta.helm.sh/release-name: jxboot-helmfile-resources
  labels:
    gitops.jenkins-x.io/pipeline: namespaces
    kapp.k14s.io/config: ""
  name: kapp-config
  namespace: jx

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karma-api-k8s
  name: karma-api-k8s-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karma-api-k8s
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karma-api-k8s
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: DB_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: DB_USER
              name: karmadb-secret
        - name: DB_PASS
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: DB_PASS
              name: karmadb-secret
        - name: MONGODB_DATABASE
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGODB_DATABASE
              name: karmadb-secret
        - name: DB_HOST
          valueFrom:
            configMapKeyRef:
              key: DB_HOST
              name: karmadb-config
        image: 199412208952/karma-api-k8s:latest
        name: karma-api-k8s
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 512Mi

##### FILE: karmada-agent.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-agent:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-agent
  name: karmada-agent
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-agent
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmada-agent
    spec:
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-agent
        - --karmada-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig/karmada-kubeconfig
        - --karmada-context=dynamic_parameters
        - --cluster-name=dynamic_parameters
        - --cluster-api-endpoint=dynamic_parameters
        - --cluster-status-update-frequency=10s
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --secure-port=10357
        - --feature-gates=CustomizedClusterResourceModeling=true,MultiClusterService=true
        - --v=4
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-agent:latest
        imagePullPolicy: dynamic_parameters
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 10357
            scheme: HTTP
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: karmada-agent
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
      serviceAccountName: karmada-agent-sa
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: karmada-kubeconfig

---

kind: Secret

  namespace: dynamic_parameters
stringData:
  kubeconfig: |-
    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Config
    clusters:
      - cluster:
          certificate-authority-data: dynamic_parameters
          insecure-skip-tls-verify: false
          server: dynamic_parameters
        name: dynamic_parameters-apiserver
    users:
      - user:
          client-certificate-data: dynamic_parameters
          client-key-data: dynamic_parameters
        name: dynamic_parameters-apiserver
    contexts:
      - context:
          cluster: dynamic_parameters-apiserver
          user: dynamic_parameters-apiserver
        name: dynamic_parameters-apiserver
    current-context: dynamic_parameters-apiserver

##### FILE: karmada-aggregated-apiserver.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-aggregated-apiserver:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    apiserver: "true"
    app: karmada-aggregated-apiserver
  name: karmada-aggregated-apiserver
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      apiserver: "true"
      app: karmada-aggregated-apiserver
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        apiserver: "true"
        app: karmada-aggregated-apiserver
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-aggregated-apiserver
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authentication-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authorization-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --etcd-servers=https://etcd-client.karmada-system.svc.cluster.local:2379
        - --etcd-cafile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-ca.crt
        - --etcd-certfile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-client.crt
        - --etcd-keyfile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-client.key
        - --tls-cert-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.crt
        - --tls-private-key-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.key
        - --audit-log-path=-
        - --feature-gates=APIPriorityAndFairness=false
        - --audit-log-maxage=0
        - --audit-log-maxbackup=0
        - --tls-min-version=VersionTLS13
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-aggregated-apiserver:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        name: karmada-aggregated-apiserver
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 1
          periodSeconds: 3
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/karmada/pki
          name: karmada-certs
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      volumes:
      - name: karmada-certs
        secret:
          secretName: karmada-cert-secret
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels: null
  name: dynamic_parameters-aggregated-apiserver
  namespace: dynamic_parameters
spec:
  replicas: dynamic_parameters
  selector:
    matchLabels: null
  strategy: null
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations: null
      labels: null
    spec:
      affinity: null
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-aggregated-apiserver
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authentication-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authorization-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --etcd-cafile=/etc/etcd/pki/ca.crt
        - --etcd-certfile=/etc/etcd/pki/tls.crt
        - --etcd-keyfile=/etc/etcd/pki/tls.key
        - --etcd-servers=dynamic_parameters
        - --etcd-prefix=dynamic_parameters
        - --etcd-cafile=/etc/etcd/pki/server-ca.crt
        - --etcd-certfile=/etc/etcd/pki/karmada.crt
        - --etcd-keyfile=/etc/etcd/pki/karmada.key
        - --etcd-servers=https://etcd-client.dynamic_parameters.svc.dynamic_parameters:2379
        - --tls-cert-file=/etc/kubernetes/pki/karmada.crt
        - --tls-private-key-file=/etc/kubernetes/pki/karmada.key
        - --audit-log-path=-
        - --feature-gates=APIPriorityAndFairness=false
        - --audit-log-maxage=0
        - --audit-log-maxbackup=0
        - --tls-min-version=VersionTLS13
        image: dynamic_parameters
        imagePullPolicy: dynamic_parameters
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        name: dynamic_parameters-aggregated-apiserver
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 1
          periodSeconds: 3
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        resources: null
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/etcd/pki
          name: etcd-cert
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/kubernetes/pki
          name: apiserver-cert
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector: null
      tolerations: null
      volumes:
      - name: apiserver-cert
        secret:
          secretName: dynamic_parameters-cert
      - name: etcd-cert
        secret:
          secretName: dynamic_parameters-external-etcd-cert

##### FILE: karmada-controller-manager.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-controller-manager:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-controller-manager
  name: karmada-controller-manager
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-controller-manager
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmada-controller-manager
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-controller-manager
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --cluster-status-update-frequency=10s
        - --secure-port=10357
        - --failover-eviction-timeout=30s
        - --controllers=*,hpaScaleTargetMarker,deploymentReplicasSyncer
        - --feature-gates=PropagationPolicyPreemption=true,MultiClusterService=true
        - --v=4
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-controller-manager:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 10357
            scheme: HTTP
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: karmada-controller-manager
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

---

##### FILE: karmada-descheduler.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-descheduler:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-descheduler
  name: karmada-descheduler
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-descheduler
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmada-descheduler
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-descheduler
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --v=4
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-descheduler:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 10358
            scheme: HTTP
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: karmada-descheduler
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

---

##### FILE: karmada-etcd.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/StatefulSet/etcd:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    app: etcd
  name: etcd
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: etcd
  serviceName: etcd
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: etcd
    spec:
      affinity:
        podAntiAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
          - labelSelector:
              matchExpressions:
              - key: app
                operator: In
                values:
                - etcd
            topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /usr/local/bin/etcd
        - --name
        - etcd0
        - --listen-peer-urls
        - http://0.0.0.0:2380
        - --listen-client-urls
        - https://0.0.0.0:2379
        - --advertise-client-urls
        - https://etcd-client.karmada-system.svc.cluster.local:2379
        - --initial-cluster
        - etcd0=http://etcd-0.etcd.karmada-system.svc.cluster.local:2380
        - --initial-cluster-state
        - new
        - --cert-file=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-server.crt
        - --client-cert-auth=true
        - --key-file=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-server.key
        - --trusted-ca-file=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-ca.crt
        - --data-dir=/var/lib/etcd
        - --snapshot-count=10000
        - --cipher-suites=TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA,TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA,TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305
        image: registry.k8s.io/etcd:3.5.9-0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - /bin/sh
            - -ec
            - etcdctl get /registry --prefix --keys-only  --endpoints https://127.0.0.1:2379  --cacert
              /etc/karmada/pki/etcd-ca.crt --cert /etc/karmada/pki/etcd-server.crt
              --key /etc/karmada/pki/etcd-server.key
          failureThreshold: 3
          initialDelaySeconds: 600
          periodSeconds: 60
          successThreshold: 1
          timeoutSeconds: 10
        name: etcd
        ports:
        - containerPort: 2379
          name: client
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 2380
          name: server
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /var/lib/etcd
          name: etcd-data
        - mountPath: /etc/karmada/pki
          name: etcd-certs
      tolerations:
      - operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - hostPath:
          path: /var/lib/karmada-etcd
          type: DirectoryOrCreate
        name: etcd-data
      - name: etcd-certs
        secret:
          secretName: karmada-cert-secret
  updateStrategy:
    type: RollingUpdate

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-interpreter-webhook-example
  name: karmada-interpreter-webhook-example
  namespace: karmada-system

  replicas: 1
  selector:

  template:

      labels:
        app: karmada-interpreter-webhook-example
    spec:

        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --secure-port=8445

        - --v=4

        name: karmada-interpreter-webhook-example

        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8445
            scheme: HTTPS
        volumeMounts:

          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
        - mountPath: /var/serving-cert
          name: cert
          readOnly: true
      serviceAccountName: karmada-interpreter-webhook-example
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig
      - name: cert
        secret:
          secretName: webhook-cert

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-metrics-adapter:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    apiserver: "true"
    app: karmada-metrics-adapter
  name: karmada-metrics-adapter
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      apiserver: "true"
      app: karmada-metrics-adapter
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        apiserver: "true"
        app: karmada-metrics-adapter
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-metrics-adapter
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authentication-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authorization-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --client-ca-file=/etc/karmada/pki/ca.crt
        - --tls-cert-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.crt
        - --tls-private-key-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.key
        - --audit-log-path=-
        - --audit-log-maxage=0
        - --audit-log-maxbackup=0
        - --tls-min-version=VersionTLS13
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-metrics-adapter:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 10
          periodSeconds: 10
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        name: karmada-metrics-adapter
        readinessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 1
          periodSeconds: 3
          timeoutSeconds: 15
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/karmada/pki
          name: karmada-certs
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      volumes:
      - name: karmada-certs
        secret:
          secretName: karmada-cert-secret
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-opensearch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-opensearch
  name: karmada-opensearch
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-opensearch
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: karmada-opensearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: DISABLE_INSTALL_DEMO_CONFIG
          value: "true"
        - name: DISABLE_SECURITY_PLUGIN
          value: "true"
        - name: OPENSEARCH_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        - name: bootstrap.memory_lock
          value: "true"
        - name: cluster.name
          value: opensearch-cluster
        - name: discovery.type
          value: single-node
        - name: node.name
          value: karmada-opensearch
        image: opensearchproject/opensearch:2.0.0
        name: karmada-opensearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: client
        - containerPort: 9600
          name: analyzer
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/opensearch/data
          name: karmada-opensearch
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
        runAsGroup: 1000
        runAsUser: 1000
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: karmada-opensearch

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-scheduler:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-scheduler
  name: karmada-scheduler
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-scheduler
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmada-scheduler
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-scheduler
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --secure-port=10351
        - --enable-scheduler-estimator=true
        - --v=4
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-scheduler:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 10351
            scheme: HTTP
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: karmada-scheduler
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5

          name: member-kubeconfig

##### FILE: karmada-search.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-search:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    apiserver: "true"
    app: karmada-search
  name: karmada-search
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      apiserver: "true"
      app: karmada-search
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        apiserver: "true"
        app: karmada-search
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-search
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authentication-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --authorization-kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --etcd-servers=https://etcd-client.karmada-system.svc.cluster.local:2379
        - --etcd-cafile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-ca.crt
        - --etcd-certfile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-client.crt
        - --etcd-keyfile=/etc/karmada/pki/etcd-client.key
        - --tls-cert-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.crt
        - --tls-private-key-file=/etc/karmada/pki/karmada.key
        - --audit-log-path=-
        - --feature-gates=APIPriorityAndFairness=false
        - --audit-log-maxage=0
        - --audit-log-maxbackup=0
        - --tls-min-version=VersionTLS13
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-search:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          failureThreshold: 3
          httpGet:
            path: /livez
            port: 443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 15
          timeoutSeconds: 5
        name: karmada-search
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/karmada/pki
          name: karmada-certs
          readOnly: true
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
      volumes:
      - name: karmada-certs
        secret:
          secretName: karmada-cert-secret
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-search

##### FILE: karmada-webhook.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karmada-system/Deployment/karmada-webhook:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmada-webhook
  name: karmada-webhook
  namespace: karmada-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmada-webhook
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmada-webhook
    spec:
      automountServiceAccountToken: false
      containers:
      - command:
        - /bin/karmada-webhook
        - --kubeconfig=/etc/kubeconfig
        - --bind-address=0.0.0.0
        - --default-not-ready-toleration-seconds=30
        - --default-unreachable-toleration-seconds=30
        - --secure-port=8443
        - --cert-dir=/var/serving-cert
        - --v=4
        image: docker.io/karmada/karmada-webhook:latest
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: karmada-webhook
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8443
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8443
            scheme: HTTPS
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/kubeconfig
          name: kubeconfig
          subPath: kubeconfig
        - mountPath: /var/serving-cert
          name: cert
          readOnly: true
      tolerations:
      - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
        operator: Exists
      volumes:
      - name: kubeconfig
        secret:
          secretName: kubeconfig
      - name: cert
        secret:
          secretName: webhook-cert

---


Mutation:

##### FILE: karmadb.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/karmadb-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karmadb
  name: karmadb-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: karmadb-k8s
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karmadb-k8s
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: DB_USER
              name: karmadb-secret
        - name: MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: DB_PASS
              name: karmadb-secret
        image: mongo:latest
        name: karmadb-k8s
        ports:
        - containerPort: 27017
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: "1"
            memory: 1024Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: karmadb-data
      volumes:
      - name: karmadb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: karmadb-pvc

---

    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-networkpolicy
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: default-deny
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""

policy add-networkpolicy-dns applied to default/Namespace/karma-prod-namespace:
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-networkpolicy-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: add-netpol-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: allow-dns
  namespace: karma-prod-namespace
spec:
  egress:
  - ports:
    - port: 53
      protocol: UDP
    to:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          name: kube-system
  podSelector:
    matchLabels: {}
  policyTypes:
  - Egress

---

Generation completed successfully.
policy add-ns-quota applied to default/Namespace/karma-prod-namespace:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ResourceQuota
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-ns-quota
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: generate-resourcequota
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: default-resourcequota
  namespace: karma-prod-namespace
spec:
  hard:
    limits.cpu: "4"
    limits.memory: 16Gi
    requests.cpu: "4"
    requests.memory: 16Gi

---

Generation completed successfully.
policy add-ns-quota applied to default/Namespace/karma-prod-namespace:
apiVersion: v1
kind: LimitRange
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-ns-quota
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: generate-limitrange
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: default-limitrange
  namespace: karma-prod-namespace
spec:
  limits:
  - default:
      cpu: 500m
      memory: 1Gi
    defaultRequest:
      cpu: 200m
      memory: 256Mi
    type: Container

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to karpenter/Deployment/karpenter:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: karpenter
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
    app.kubernetes.io/name: karpenter
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 0.24.0
    helm.sh/chart: karpenter-v0.24.0
  name: karpenter
  namespace: karpenter
spec:
  replicas: 2
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/instance: karpenter
      app.kubernetes.io/name: karpenter
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxUnavailable: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        checksum/settings: 2f12e017e74649875e78e4cdc8b06340ed07891a7002b5a3486cdc02f2705eaa
      labels:
        app.kubernetes.io/instance: karpenter
        app.kubernetes.io/name: karpenter
    spec:
      affinity:
        nodeAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
            nodeSelectorTerms:
            - matchExpressions:
              - key: karpenter.sh/provisioner-name
                operator: DoesNotExist
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_MIN_VERSION
          value: 1.19.0-0
        - name: KARPENTER_SERVICE
          value: karpenter
        - name: WEBHOOK_PORT
          value: "8443"
        - name: METRICS_PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: HEALTH_PROBE_PORT
          value: "8081"
        - name: SYSTEM_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: MEMORY_LIMIT
          valueFrom:
            resourceFieldRef:
              containerName: controller
              divisor: "0"
              resource: limits.memory
        image: public.ecr.aws/karpenter/controller:v0.24.0@sha256:83e7a21200efd4e17314c931aa715c9c73b27fcbf08673d263c007029ad754da
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: http
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        name: controller
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http-metrics
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 8081
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 8443
          name: https-webhook
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: http
          timeoutSeconds: 30
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1
            memory: 1Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 1
            memory: 1Gi
      dnsPolicy: Default
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      priorityClassName: system-cluster-critical
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
      serviceAccountName: karpenter
      tolerations:
      - key: CriticalAddonsOnly
        operator: Exists
      topologySpreadConstraints:
      - labelSelector:
          matchLabels:
            app.kubernetes.io/instance: karpenter
            app.kubernetes.io/name: karpenter
        maxSkew: 1
        topologyKey: topology.kubernetes.io/zone
        whenUnsatisfiable: ScheduleAnyway

##### FILE: karsajobs-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/karsajobs-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: karsajobs
    tier: backend
  name: karsajobs-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      tier: backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: karsajobs
        tier: backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: APP_PORT
          value: "8080"
        - name: MONGO_HOST
          value: mongo-service
        - name: MONGO_USER
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_ROOT_USERNAME
              name: mongo-secret
        - name: MONGO_PASS
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_ROOT_PASSWORD
              name: mongo-secret
        image: ghcr.io/alvianfahrul/karsajobs:latest
        name: karsajobs-container
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1
            memory: 512Mi

---

##### FILE: kavita.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/kavita:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: kavita
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: kavita
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: kavita
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: TZ
          value: America/Los_Angeles
        - name: PUID
          value: "1024"
        - name: PGID
          value: "100"
        image: linuxserver/kavita:0.8.3
        name: kavita
        ports:
        - containerPort: 5000
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: kavita-config
        - mountPath: /data
          name: kavita-data
      restartPolicy: Always
      volumes:
      - name: kavita-config
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: kavita-config-claim
      - name: kavita-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: nfs-claim

---

kind: Job

  name: kbench
  namespace: default

  backoffLimit: 0
  template:

      labels:
        kbench: fio
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: FILE_NAME
          value: /volume/test
        - name: SIZE
          value: 30G
        - name: CPU_IDLE_PROF
          value: disabled
        image: yasker/kbench:latest
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: kbench
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /volume/
          name: vol
      restartPolicy: Never
      volumes:
      - name: vol
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: kbench-pvc

##### FILE: kc_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/keycloak:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keycloak
  name: keycloak
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keycloak
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keycloak
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - start
        - --cache-stack=kubernetes
        env:
        - name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
          value: admin
        - name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
          value: admin
        - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /etc/certs/tls.crt
        - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_KEY_FILE
          value: /etc/certs/tls.key
        - name: KC_HEALTH_ENABLED
          value: "true"
        - name: KC_METRICS_ENABLED
          value: "true"
        - name: KC_HOSTNAME
          value: auth.localtest.me
        - name: KC_PROXY
          value: edge
        - name: KC_DB
          value: postgres
        - name: KC_DB_URL
          value: jdbc:postgresql://keycloak-db-postgresql-ha-pgpool/postgres
        - name: KC_DB_USERNAME
          value: postgres
        - name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: password
              name: keycloak-db-postgresql-ha-postgresql
        - name: jgroups.dns.query
          value: keycloak
        image: quay.io/keycloak/keycloak:20.0.2
        name: keycloak
        ports:
        - containerPort: 7600
          name: jgroups
        - containerPort: 8443
          name: https
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /health/ready
            port: 8443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 60
          periodSeconds: 1
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/certs
          name: certs
          readOnly: true
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        secret:
          secretName: auth-tls-secret

---

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: null
  labels:
    run: connect-worker-1
  name: connect-worker-1
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - env:
    - name: BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS
      value: test-kafka.default.svc.cluster.local:9092
    - name: SASL_USER
      value: user1
    - name: SECURITY_PROTOCOL
      value: PLAINTEXT
    - name: SASL_PASSWORD
      value: password
    - name: LISTENER_PORT
      value: "8081"
    - name: REST_ADVERTISED_LISTENER
      value: http
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: KEY_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: VALUE_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_PORT
      value: "8080"
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_OPTS
      value: -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote=true -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false
        -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.rmi.port=8080
        -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=$(KAFKA_JMX_HOSTNAME) -javaagent:/u01/cnfkfk/etc/kafka/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar=8080:/u01/cnfkfk/etc/kafka/kafka-connect.yml
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_HOSTNAME
      value: connect-worker-1
    - name: BROKER_LISTENER_MODE
      value: PLAINTEXT
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_MODE
      value: HTTP
    - name: KAFKA_HEAP_OPTS
      value: -Xmx512M -Xms512M
    - name: KAFKA_OPTS
      value: -Dlogging.level=INFO
    image: dwijad/kafka-connect:latest
    name: connect-worker-1
    resources: {}
  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst
  restartPolicy: Always
status: {}

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/connect-worker-1:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: null
  labels:
    run: connect-worker-1
  name: connect-worker-1
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - env:
    - name: BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS
      value: test-kafka.default.svc.cluster.local:9092
    - name: SASL_USER
      value: user1
    - name: SECURITY_PROTOCOL
      value: SSL
    - name: SASL_PASSWORD
      value: password
    - name: LISTENER_PORT
      value: "8081"
    - name: REST_ADVERTISED_LISTENER
      value: https
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: KEY_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: VALUE_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: http://sr-service-http.default.svc:8081
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_PORT
      value: "8080"
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_OPTS
      value: -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote=true -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false
        -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.rmi.port=8080
        -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=$(KAFKA_JMX_HOSTNAME) -javaagent:/u01/cnfkfk/etc/kafka/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar=8080:/u01/cnfkfk/etc/kafka/kafka-connect.yml
    - name: BROKER_LISTENER_MODE
      value: SSL
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_MODE
      value: HTTP
    - name: KAFKA_HEAP_OPTS
      value: -Xmx512M -Xms512M
    - name: KAFKA_OPTS
      value: -Dlogging.level=INFO
    image: dwijad/kafka-connect:latest
    name: connect-worker-1
    resources: {}
  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst
  restartPolicy: Always
status: {}

kind: Pod

  containers:
  - env:
    - name: BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS
      value: test-kafka.default.svc.cluster.local:9092
    - name: SASL_USER
      value: user1
    - name: SECURITY_PROTOCOL
      value: SSL
    - name: SASL_PASSWORD
      value: password
    - name: LISTENER_PORT
      value: "8081"
    - name: REST_ADVERTISED_LISTENER
      value: https
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: https://sr-service-https.default.svc:8081
    - name: KEY_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: https://sr-service-https.default.svc:8081
    - name: VALUE_CONVERTER_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL
      value: https://sr-service-https.default.svc:8081
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_PORT
      value: "8080"
    - name: KAFKA_JMX_OPTS
      value: -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote=true -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false
        -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.rmi.port=8080

    - name: BROKER_LISTENER_MODE
      value: SSL
    - name: SCHEMA_REGISTRY_MODE
      value: HTTPS
    - name: KAFKA_HEAP_OPTS
      value: -Xmx512M -Xms512M
    - name: KAFKA_OPTS
      value: -Dlogging.level=INFO
    image: dwijad/kafka-connect:latest
    name: connect-worker-1
    resources: {}

  restartPolicy: Always

        - start-dev

        - --spi-email-template-freemarker-plus-mustache-enabled=true
        - --spi-theme-cache-themes=false

        - configMapRef:
            name: keycloak-cm
        image: docker.io/dsoderlund/keycloak-multitenant:latest
        name: keycloak
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 2Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 500Mi

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to keda/Deployment/keda-admission:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keda-admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/component: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/name: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.10.0
  name: keda-admission
  namespace: keda
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keda-admission-webhooks
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keda-admission-webhooks
        name: keda-admission-webhooks
      name: keda-admission-webhooks
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --zap-log-level=info
        - --zap-encoder=console
        - --zap-time-encoding=rfc3339
        command:
        - /keda-admission-webhooks
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: WATCH_NAMESPACE
          value: ""
        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          value: ""
        image: ghcr.io/kedacore/keda-admission-webhooks:2.10.0
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 25
        name: keda-admission-webhooks
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9443
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: metrics
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ValidatingWebhookConfiguration/keda-admission:
apiVersion: admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1
kind: ValidatingWebhookConfiguration
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/component: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/created-by: keda
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kustomize
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.10.0
  name: keda-admission
  namespace: default
webhooks:
- admissionReviewVersions:
  - v1
  clientConfig:
    service:
      name: keda-admission-webhooks
      namespace: keda
      path: /validate-keda-sh-v1alpha1-scaledobject
  failurePolicy: Ignore
  matchPolicy: Equivalent
  name: vscaledobject.kb.io
  namespaceSelector: {}
  objectSelector: {}
  rules:

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to autoscaling/Deployment/keda-admission:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keda-admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/component: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/name: admission-webhooks
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.15.1
  name: keda-admission
  namespace: autoscaling
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keda-admission-webhooks
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keda-admission-webhooks
        name: keda-admission-webhooks
      name: keda-admission-webhooks
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --zap-log-level=info
        - --zap-encoder=console
        - --zap-time-encoding=rfc3339
        command:
        - /keda-admission-webhooks
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: WATCH_NAMESPACE
          value: ""
        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          value: ""
        image: ghcr.io/kedacore/keda-admission-webhooks:2.15.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 25
        name: keda-admission-webhooks
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9443
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: metrics
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

---

##### FILE: keda-2.15.1_20.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to autoscaling/Deployment/keda-operator:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/component: operator
    app.kubernetes.io/name: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.15.1
  name: keda-operator
  namespace: autoscaling
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keda-operator
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keda-operator
        name: keda-operator
      name: keda-operator
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --leader-elect
        - --zap-log-level=info
        - --zap-encoder=console
        - --zap-time-encoding=rfc3339
        - --enable-cert-rotation=true
        command:
        - /keda
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: WATCH_NAMESPACE
          value: ""
        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          value: ""
        image: ghcr.io/kedacore/keda:2.15.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 25
        name: keda-operator
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          optional: true
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

        app: keda-admission-webhooks

        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT

        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 25
        name: keda-admission-webhooks
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9443
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: metrics
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

##### FILE: keda-2.15.11_19.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to autoscaling/Deployment/keda-metrics-apiserver:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keda-metrics-apiserver
    app.kubernetes.io/name: keda-metrics-apiserver
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.15.1
  name: keda-metrics-apiserver
  namespace: autoscaling
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keda-metrics-apiserver
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: keda-metrics-apiserver
      name: keda-metrics-apiserver
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - /usr/local/bin/keda-adapter
        - --secure-port=6443
        - --logtostderr=true
        - --stderrthreshold=ERROR
        - --v=0
        - --client-ca-file=/certs/ca.crt
        - --tls-cert-file=/certs/tls.crt
        - --tls-private-key-file=/certs/tls.key
        - --cert-dir=/certs
        env:
        - name: WATCH_NAMESPACE
          value: ""
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          value: ""
        image: ghcr.io/kedacore/keda-metrics-apiserver:2.15.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 6443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        name: keda-metrics-apiserver
        ports:
        - containerPort: 6443
          name: https
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 6443
            scheme: HTTPS
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /tmp
          name: temp-vol
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: temp-vol
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

---

##### FILE: keda-2.15.11_20.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to autoscaling/Deployment/keda-operator:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/component: operator
    app.kubernetes.io/name: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: keda-operator
    app.kubernetes.io/version: 2.15.1
  name: keda-operator
  namespace: autoscaling
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: keda-operator
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: keda-operator
        name: keda-operator
      name: keda-operator
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --leader-elect
        - --zap-log-level=info
        - --zap-encoder=console
        - --zap-time-encoding=rfc3339
        - --enable-cert-rotation=true
        command:
        - /keda
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: WATCH_NAMESPACE
          value: ""
        - name: KEDA_HTTP_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          value: ""
        image: ghcr.io/kedacore/keda:2.15.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 25
        name: keda-operator
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 20
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1000Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 100Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsNonRoot: true
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certificates
          readOnly: true
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
      serviceAccountName: keda-operator
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - name: certificates
        secret:
          defaultMode: 420
          optional: true
          secretName: kedaorg-certs

---

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    deploy: keda-deploy
  name: keda-deploy
  namespace: anveshtest
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      run: keda-deploy
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        run: keda-deploy
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: memcached
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: keda-deploy
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 100Mi
          requests:
            memory: 50Mi

##### FILE: keepalived_patch.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/ironic:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: ironic
  namespace: default
spec:
  template:
    spec:
      containers:
      - envFrom:
        - configMapRef:
            name: ironic-bmo-configmap
        image: quay.io/metal3-io/keepalived
        name: ironic-endpoint-keepalived
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: true
          capabilities:
            add:
            - NET_ADMIN
            - NET_BROADCAST
            - NET_RAW
            drop:
            - ALL
          privileged: false
          runAsGroup: 65532
          runAsUser: 65532

---

##### FILE: kelvin_deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/kelvin:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: kelvin
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: kelvin
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        name: kelvin
        plane: data
    spec:
      affinity:
        nodeAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
            nodeSelectorTerms:
            - matchExpressions:
              - key: kubernetes.io/os
                operator: Exists
              - key: kubernetes.io/os
                operator: In
                values:
                - linux
            - matchExpressions:
              - key: beta.kubernetes.io/os
                operator: Exists
              - key: beta.kubernetes.io/os
                operator: In
                values:
                - linux
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PL_HOST_PATH
          value: /host
        - name: PL_POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: PL_POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: PL_HOST_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.hostIP
        - name: PL_JWT_SIGNING_KEY
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: jwt-signing-key
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
        - name: PL_VIZIER_ID
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: cluster-id
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
              optional: true
        - name: PL_VIZIER_NAME
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: cluster-name
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
              optional: true
        - name: PL_POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: TCMALLOC_SAMPLE_PARAMETER
          value: "1048576"
        envFrom:
        - configMapRef:
            name: pl-tls-config
        image: vizier-kelvin_image:latest
        name: app
        ports:
        - containerPort: 59300
        resources: {}
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certs
        - mountPath: /sys
          name: sys
          readOnly: true
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - 'set -x; URL="https://${SERVICE_NAME}:${SERVICE_PORT}/healthz"; until [
          $(curl -m 0.5 -s -o /dev/null -w "%!{(MISSING)http_code}" -k ${URL}) -eq 200 ]; do
          echo "waiting for ${URL}"; sleep 2; done; '
        env:
        - name: SERVICE_NAME
          value: vizier-query-broker-svc
        - name: SERVICE_PORT
          value: "50300"
        image: gcr.io/pixie-oss/pixie-dev-public/curl:multiarch-7.87.0@sha256:f7f265d5c64eb4463a43a99b6bf773f9e61a50aaa7cefaf564f43e42549a01dd
        name: qb-wait
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 10100
        runAsGroup: 10100
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 10100
        seccompProfile:
          type: RuntimeDefault
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        secret:
          secretName: service-tls-certs
      - hostPath:
          path: /sys
          type: Directory
        name: sys

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/kelvin:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: kelvin
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: kelvin
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        name: kelvin
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ASAN_OPTIONS
          value: halt_on_error=0
        - name: TSAN_OPTIONS
          value: halt_on_error=0
        - name: PL_HOST_PATH
          value: /host
        - name: PL_POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: PL_POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: PL_HOST_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.hostIP
        - name: PL_JWT_SIGNING_KEY
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: jwt-signing-key
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
        envFrom:
        - configMapRef:
            name: pl-tls-config
        image: vizier-kelvin_image:latest
        name: app
        ports:
        - containerPort: 59300
          hostPort: 59300
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 4096Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 2048Mi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certs
        - mountPath: /sys
          name: sys
          readOnly: true
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - 'set -x; URL="https://${SERVICE_NAME}:${SERVICE_PORT}/healthz"; until [
          $(curl -m 0.5 -s -o /dev/null -w "%!{(MISSING)http_code}" -k ${URL}) -eq 200 ]; do
          echo "waiting for ${URL}"; sleep 2; done; '
        env:
        - name: SERVICE_NAME
          value: vizier-query-broker-svc
        - name: SERVICE_PORT
          value: "50300"
        image: gcr.io/pixie-oss/pixie-dev-public/curl:multiarch-7.87.0@sha256:f7f265d5c64eb4463a43a99b6bf773f9e61a50aaa7cefaf564f43e42549a01dd
        name: qb-wait
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        secret:
          secretName: service-tls-certs
      - hostPath:
          path: /sys
          type: Directory
        name: sys

##### FILE: kelvin_deployment2.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/kelvin:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: kelvin
  namespace: default
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: kelvin
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        name: kelvin
        plane: data
    spec:
      affinity:
        nodeAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
            nodeSelectorTerms:
            - matchExpressions:
              - key: kubernetes.io/os
                operator: Exists
              - key: kubernetes.io/os
                operator: In
                values:
                - linux
            - matchExpressions:
              - key: beta.kubernetes.io/os
                operator: Exists
              - key: beta.kubernetes.io/os
                operator: In
                values:
                - linux
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: PL_HOST_PATH
          value: /host
        - name: PL_POD_NAME
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: PL_POD_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.podIP
        - name: PL_HOST_IP
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: status.hostIP
        - name: PL_JWT_SIGNING_KEY
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: jwt-signing-key
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
        - name: PL_VIZIER_ID
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: cluster-id
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
              optional: true
        - name: PL_VIZIER_NAME
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: cluster-name
              name: pl-cluster-secrets
              optional: true
        - name: PL_POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: TCMALLOC_SAMPLE_PARAMETER
          value: "1048576"
        envFrom:
        - configMapRef:
            name: pl-tls-config
        image: vizier-kelvin_image:latest
        name: app
        ports:
        - containerPort: 59300
        resources: {}
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /certs
          name: certs
        - mountPath: /sys
          name: sys
          readOnly: true
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - 'set -x; URL="https://${SERVICE_NAME}:${SERVICE_PORT}/healthz"; until [
          $(curl -m 0.5 -s -o /dev/null -w "%!{(MISSING)http_code}" -k ${URL}) -eq 200 ]; do
          echo "waiting for ${URL}"; sleep 2; done; '
        env:
        - name: SERVICE_NAME
          value: vizier-query-broker-svc
        - name: SERVICE_PORT
          value: "50300"
        image: gcr.io/pixie-oss/pixie-dev-public/curl:multiarch-7.87.0@sha256:f7f265d5c64eb4463a43a99b6bf773f9e61a50aaa7cefaf564f43e42549a01dd
        name: qb-wait
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 10100
        runAsGroup: 10100
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 10100
        seccompProfile:
          type: RuntimeDefault
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        secret:
          secretName: service-tls-certs
      - hostPath:
          path: /sys
          type: Directory
        name: sys

    port: 59300
    protocol: TCP
    targetPort: 59300
  selector:
    name: kelvin
  type: ClusterIP

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to k8gb/ConfigMap/krb5.conf:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  krb5.conf: |
    [logging]
      default = FILE:/var/log/krb5libs.log
      kdc = FILE:/var/log/krb5kdc.log
      admin_server = FILE:/var/log/kadmind.log

    [libdefaults]
      dns_lookup_realm = false
      ticket_lifetime = 24h
      renew_lifetime = 7d
      forwardable = true
      rdns = false
      default_ccache_name = KEYRING:persistent:%!{(MISSING)uid}
      default_realm = REALM.LOCAL

    [realms]
     REALM.LOCAL = {
      kdc = DC.domain.local:88
      admin_server = DC.domain.local
    }

    [domain_realm]
      realm.local= REALM.LOCAL
      .realm.local = REALM.LOCAL
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: krb5.conf
  namespace: k8gb

---
